elements.description:
A text form item.

If the browser has native support for FormData (and iterators) then it will also render
a content type selector for the input field.

properties.name: name

properties.description: A view model.

properties.name: docsOpened
properties.description: True to render documentation (if set in model)

properties.name: _mimeInput
properties.description: Reference to the mime type input

properties.name: type
properties.description: A content type of the form field to be presented in the Multipart request.

properties.name: suggestions
properties.description: List of suggested mime types

properties.name: hasFormData
properties.description: If set it will also renders mime type selector for the input data.

methods.name: toggleDocumentation
methods.description: Toggles documentation (if available)

methods.name: _computeHasFile

methods.name: _selectFile
methods.description:
A handler to choose file button click.
This function will find a proper input[type="file"] and programatically click on it to open
file dialog.

methods.name: _fileObjectChanged
methods.description:
A handler to file change event for input[type="file"].
This will update files array for corresponding `this.filesList` array object.

methods.name: _computeAccept
methods.description: Computes the `accept`attribute for file input.

elements.description:
Multipart payload editor for ARC/API Console body editor.

On supported browsers (full support for FormData, Iterator and ArrayBuffer) it will render a
UI controls to generate payload message preview.

It produces a FormData object that can be used in XHR / Fetch or transformed to ArrayBuffer to be
used in socket connection.

### Example
```html
<multipart-payload-editor value="{{form}}"></multipart-payload-editor>
```

## Data model from FormData

The element creates a data model for the form view from FormData object.
The limitation of this solution is that the information about initial part type
is lost. In case when the user specified the part as a text part but also added
part content type it will be recognized as the file part.

Note: this only works in browsers that support full FormData spec which rules
out any Microsoft product. **You have to include polyfills for the FormData.**

### Styling

`<multipart-payload-editor>` provides the following custom properties and mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--multipart-payload-editor` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`
`--multipart-payload-editor-code-preview` | Mixin applied to a code preview element | `{}`
`--view-action-bar` | Theme mixin, applied to the content action bar | `{}`
`--multipart-payload-editor-action-bar` | Mixin applied to the content action bar | `{}`
`--body-editor-panel-button-active-background-color` | Background color of the active content action button | `#e0e0e0`
`--body-editor-panel-button-active` | Mixin applied to active content action button | `{}`
`--content-action-icon-color` | Color of the content action icon | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`
`--content-action-icon-color-hover` | Color of the content action icon when hovered | `--accent-color` or `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`
`--inline-documentation-color` | Color of the description text from a RAML type. | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.87)`
`--from-row-action-icon-color` | Color of the icon buttons next to the input fields | `--icon-button-color` or `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`
`--from-row-action-icon-color-hover` | Color of the icon buttons next to the input fields when hovering | `--accent-color` or `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.74)`,
`--multipart-payload-editor-file-trigger-color` | Color of the file dialog trigger button. | `--accent-color` or `#FF5722`

This element also inherits styles from
`advanced-rest-client/api-form-mixin/api-form-styles.html` element to
style form controls.

properties.name: model
properties.description: View model to use to render the form.

properties.name: optionalOpened
properties.description: Set to true to show optional parameters (not required by the API).

properties.name: hasOptional
properties.description:
Computed value from `allowHideOptional` and view model.
`true` if current model has any optional property.

properties.name: allowHideOptional
properties.description:
If set it computes `hasOptional` property and shows checkbox in the
form to show / hide optional properties.

properties.name: renderOptionalCheckbox
properties.description: Computed flag to determine if optional checkbox can be rendered

properties.name: allowDisableParams
properties.description:
If set, enable / disable param checkbox is rendered next to each
form item.

properties.name: allowCustom
properties.description:
When set, renders "add custom" item button.
If the element is to be used withouth AMF model this should always
be enabled. Otherwise users won't be able to add a parameter.

properties.name: narrow
properties.description: Renders items in "narrow" view

properties.name: renderEmptyMessage
properties.description:
Computed value. The form renders empty message (if supported by
the form element). It occurs when model is not set and allowCustom
is not set

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of this form

properties.name: hasFormDataSupport
properties.description: True if the browser has native FormData support.

properties.name: previewOpened
properties.description: true if the message preview is opened

properties.name: generatingPreview
properties.description: true if the transformer is generating the message

properties.name: messagePreview
properties.description: Generated body message preview

methods.name: computeFormRowClass
methods.description: Computes class name for each form item depending on the item state.

params.name: optionalOpened
params.description: True if optional parameters are rendered.

methods.name: toggleOptionalParams
methods.description: Toggles visibility of optional parameters.

methods.name: _getForm
methods.description:
Returns a reference to the form element, if the DOM is ready.
This only works with `iron-form` that is in the DOM.

return.desc:
Iron form element. It may be `undefined` if local
DOM is not yet initialized.

methods.name: _getValidity
methods.description:
Validates the form. It uses `iron-form`'s `validate()` function to
perform the validation.

return.desc: Validation result or `true` if DOM is not yet ready.

methods.name: serializeForm
methods.description: Link to the form's serialize function.

return.desc:
Serialized form values or `undefined` if DOM is not ready.
Note, `undefined` is returned **only** if DOM is not yet ready.

methods.name: _computeHasOptionalParameters
methods.description:
Computes if any of the parameters are required.
It iterates over the model to find any first element that has `required`
propeerty set to `false`.

params.name: allowHideOptional
params.description:
State of `allowHideOptional` property.
If `false` this function always returns `false`.

params.name: record
params.description:
Change record. Note, it does not checks for
optional parameters each time the model changes. It rescans the model
when splices changed.

return.desc: `true` if model has at leas one alement that is not required.

methods.name: _computeRenderCheckbox
methods.description: Computes value for `renderOptionalCheckbox` property.

methods.name: _computeIsCustom
methods.description:
Computes if given model item is a custom property (not generated by
AMF model transformation).

return.desc:
`true` if `isCustom` property is set on model's schema
property.

methods.name: addCustom
methods.description:
Adds empty custom property to the list.

It dispatches `api-property-model-build` custom event that is handled by
`api-view-model-transformer` to build model item.
This assumem that the transformer element is already in the DOM.

After the transformation the element pushes or sets the data to the
`model`.

params.name: opts
params.description:
Additional options:
- inputLabel {String} - Forces a label of the input

methods.name: _removeCustom
methods.description:
Removes custom item from the UI.
This can only be called from `dom-repeat` element so it contain's
`model` property.

methods.name: computeIsOptional
methods.description:
Computes if model item is optional.
The items is always optional if is not required and when `hasOptional`
is set to `true`.

return.desc: `true` if the model item is optional in the form.

methods.name: _computeRenderEmptyMessage
methods.description: Computes value for `renderEmptyMessage`.

params.name: allowCustom
params.description: True if the form allows to add custom values.

return.desc: `true` when allowCustom is falsy set and model is empty

methods.name: addFile
methods.description:
Appends new file form row.
This changes `model`.

methods.name: addText
methods.description:
Appends empty text field to the form.
This changes `model`.

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description:
Handler for value change.
If the element is opened then it will fire change event.

methods.name: _restoreFormData
methods.description:
Transforms FormData into the data model.
Sets new model data.

methods.name: _createModelObject
methods.description:
It dispatches `api-property-model-build` custom event that is handled by
`api-view-model-transformer` to build model item.
This assumes that the transformer element is already in the DOM.

methods.name: _blobToString
methods.description: Transforms `Blob` to string.

methods.name: _modelAndValueMatch
methods.description: Tests if current model and FormData object represent the same form data.

return.desc: True if model represents data in FormData object

methods.name: _previewOpenedChanged
methods.description: Generates a message and displays highlighted content of the message.

methods.name: _modelChanged
methods.description: Called when the model chage. Regenerates the FormData object.

methods.name: createFormData
methods.description:
Generates FormData from the model.
For the browsers with full FormData support it will generate Form data object from form
element. It means that it will have only basic support.
For browsers with full FormData support it will contain all properties (including
mime types).

methods.name: _getFormData
methods.description: Generates the FormData object from the model instead of the form.

params.name: model
params.description: The model to generate form data from.

return.desc: Form data from model or undefined if model is empty.

methods.name: _getLegacyFormData
methods.description:
Returns a FormData object depending if current form has any value.
Text items can be empty.

params.name: model
params.description: The model to generate form data from.

return.desc:
Form data from model or undefined if model
is empty.

methods.name: _generatePreview
methods.description: Generates a preview message from the FormData object.

return.desc:
A promise fulfilled with the content. Content can be undefined
if message couldn't be generated because of lack of support.

methods.name: _copyToClipboard
methods.description: Handler for copy to clipboard click.

demos.description: With AMF model from RAML file
